title: Weighted Coverage â€” detect rare corner-cases and prioritize tests
description: Design coverpoints and weight bins so rare events are visible and prioritized. Explain how you'd schedule tests to focus on low-coverage, high-risk bins.

examples.input: coverpoint pkt.type with bins normal, rare_error, corruption; weight corruption higher
examples.output: Coverage report highlights low hits for 'corruption' bin; target tests to increase hits for it
examples.explanation: Use bin weights and cross with other fields; instrument driver to bias generation when needed.

constraints: Avoid over-biasing tests such that production-like behavior is lost; use directed tests alongside constrained-random runs.
hints: Use 'weight' or pragma to mark bins more important.
Use targeted sequences that force rare states for regression tests.
